title: [Moonglae Inn, Rooftop Park]
description: Some clover blooms amidst the grass in the western section of the rooftop lawn, which is partially shaded by a row of flowering dogwoods growing in the large granite planters nearby.  Across the city to the southwest, you see the immense rotunda of the Hall of Patrons, its twin white marble columns shining brightly in the sun.

Some clover blooms amidst the grass in the western section of the rooftop lawn, which is sheltered by a row of flowering dogwoods growing in the large granite planters nearby.  Across the city to the southwest, you can identify the darkened shape of the Hall of Patrons by its immense rotunda and the twin white marble columns clearly visible with reflected moonlight.
